Welcome to our tranquil haven for dogs and their owners in Bridgwater! Nestled on 2.5 acres of pristine land, our secure dog walking field offers a unique and safe environment for your furry companions to roam freely. With breath-taking views of the Quantock Hills, and even Wales on a clear day, our location provides a picturesque backdrop for your walks.

Our secure dog walking field in Bridgwater ensures that your beloved pets can explore and play to their heart’s content without the worry of wandering off or encountering unfamiliar hazards. For nervous or reactive dogs, our enclosed space offers a sanctuary where they can feel secure and relaxed, away from the stressors of the outside world.

Our field is enclosed by 6ft fencing and features an air lock gate, providing protection to prevent any escape attempts. Whether your dog needs space to build confidence, overcome anxiety, or simply enjoy a peaceful environment, our dedicated field provides the perfect solution.

Experience the joy of watching your canine companions thrive in a secure and beautiful setting while enjoying the serenity of the surrounding landscape. Welcome to your dog’s new favourite playground in Bridgwater!

location: Bristol, Dundry, North Somerset, Somerset, England
description:
A Shining Example of Canine Paradise:  Bristoldogfield.co.uk  Secure Dog Exercise Field
A few years ago, I found myself daydreaming about owning a small piece of land—just a couple of acres where I could plant trees, grow some fruit bushes and vegetables, and most importantly, create a secure, beautiful space for my dogs to run free. I imagined that one day, I might even open it to the public so others could enjoy it too. Then, of course, the world changed—Covid struck, land prices soared, and the dream seemed to drift just out of reach. Still, I held onto hope.
Then one day, while scrolling Facebook, I stumbled upon a post by Karl Wilson announcing his plans to create a dog exercise field in Dundry, Bristol. I was stunned and delighted—it was exactly what I had envisioned, but better yet, it was less than ten minutes from my home. I followed the journey from planning application to approval, cheering from the sidelines. But nothing could have prepared me for what Karl has actually achieved.
This week, I finally visited pawsforpleasure.co.uk Dog Field with my dogs and have time to add some images—and to say I was blown away is an understatement.
This is not just a dog field. This is a canine sanctuary, crafted with love, intention, and remarkable attention to detail. From the moment you arrive, it’s clear that nothing has been overlooked. The drive-in entrance and spacious turning circle are built to withstand the quirks of British weather. The field itself—an expansive 4.5 acres—is a thoughtful blend of manicured mown paths and wild, free-growing grasses. These paths meander naturally, inviting exploration rather than simply leading from A to B.
Every feature has been carefully designed for comfort and joy—not just for the dogs, but for their humans too. There are canopied picnic benches for rest and reflection, and a shelter in the centre of the field for those unexpected showers. For the dogs? Think bridges, rocks, A-frames, high walks, tunnels, balance paths, and even a pond—a full adventure playground catering to everything from the energetic explorer to the curious sniffer.
But the brilliance of this field doesn’t end with its amenities or its breathtaking views of Bristol, The Clifton Suspension Bridge, The 2nd severn Crossing and beyond into wales. 
What truly elevates Dundry Dog Field to something exceptional is Karl’s unwavering commitment to the environment. He hasn’t just created a field; he’s created an ecosystem. With wildflower meadows, layered hedgerows, specimen trees, and an owl box, this space is a thriving habitat-in-the-making for countless birds and wildlife. The sheer investment into the planting alone is nothing short of extraordinary—Karl is quite literally planting a forest for the future.
I’ve had the pleasure of speaking with Karl many times throughout the planning process, and one thing is abundantly clear: this isn’t just a business. It’s a legacy project. His vision reaches far beyond dog walks and day-to-day use. He understands, deeply, the value of trees, of natural beauty, of spaces that nourish both animals and people. His work is a gift not only to the local community today, but to generations to come. 
"The true meaning of life is to plant trees under whose shade you do not expect to sit." – Nelson Henderson
As a homeopath for both people and pets, I understand the vital role that exercise, fresh air, and joy play in overall well-being. This activity ticks all the boxes—for both our animals and ourselves.
www.homeopathypetcoaching.com & www.homeopathshaz.com 
In Bristol terms, this place is “gurt lush.” It’s everything you could dream of in a dog exercise field—and more. Karl Wilson has created something truly outstanding, and it deserves recognition, celebration, and wholehearted support.
Because while the field is beautiful now, its true magic is in the future it's quietly growing—with every pawprint on the path and every tree planted for tomorrow.

Our dog play park is designed with your dog's happiness and safety in mind, offering a unique and valuable service for dog owners in the area.

Bonkers Off-Lead: Does your dog go wild when let off the lead? Our spacious, off-lead dog park is perfect for those high-energy dogs that need room to run, jump, and play to their heart's content. Let them burn off that excess energy in a safe and controlled environment.

Anxious or Reactive Around Other Dogs: We know that some dogs are nervous or defensive around other dogs, making walks a stressful experience for both of you. field_name: PUPS PADDOCK Secure Dog Walking Field
location: Calf Fallow Lane, Ts20 1pf, Durham|North Yorkshire
description:
Introducing Pups Paddock, a secure dog walking field where pet owners and dog walkers can bring their dogs to enjoy off-leash exercise in a controlled environment.
Our one-acre field is enclosed on all sides with a six foot fence creating a secure haven for dogs to socialise, exercise, and have fun.
 
Getting here
This is a Google maps link to the field entrance. Copy and paste in to your browser to use Google maps directions.
https://maps.app.goo.gl/Qui8EPHXvrMFCD7p9
Alternatively, if you're familiar with the area, follow these instructions :
We’re on a private track down Calf Fallow Lane, our farm is called Follyfoot Banks. Our what3words are ///idea.cape.moon.
From Station Road, Norton, cross the railway line and the entrance to Calf Fallow Lane is straight ahead of you. Please respect our neighbours as you go, there may be livestock, working animals, children and machinery on the track, always give way to them and be patient. Do not exceed 10mph.
Follow the lane down to Brookfield Farm and turn right up a short bank. From here you will continue along a short private track for around two minutes. You will pass private dwellings, please respect our neighbours and drive carefully and slowly. We’re amongst working farms so there could be livestock, horses and children.
Access to the field is on the left-hand side of the private track, look out for the big black metal gate (photo in gallery), the gate opens outwards.
Parking is available inside the field by way of hardstanding, a maximum of two vehicles are allowed at any one time.
 
FAQ
Can I just turn up? No sorry, booking is by appointment only.
How much is it? The price is £12 for up to 3 dogs, £1 per dog thereafter, up to a maximum of 6 dogs.
How long do I get in the field? Each slot is for 45 minutes and starts on the hour, longer appointments are available, please get in touch to discuss - pupspaddock@gmail.com.
Can I take my trainer with me? Yes, absolutely, however we do not condone any kind of negative training.
 
Important info
Please read the terms and conditions carefully.
No smoking or vaping on site.
Please take all litter, treats and toys home with you to avoid them causing a problem for others.
Please pick up your dogs poo and place in the bin provided.
There's a bucket of soil in the field, please fill any holes your dog makes and report immediately for safety and security reasons.
The field will be checked periodically but if you spot any problems please report immediately.

description:
Fully enclosed field of approximately 1.5-2 acres with 6 foot high fencing.  The field is available to hire by the hour for exclusive use.  All bookings are made via our online booking system.
A great place to bring your dog or dogs to do some training in an enclosed area without the distraction of people and other dogs. 
Excellent for a dog that perhaps is reactive or nervous when it meets other dogs on walks.

Dog walkers and trainers welcome.

location: North End Lane, Halewood, Knowsley, Knowsley, Liverpool City Region, England, L26 5QB, Merseyside
description:
New for August 2023, Zoomies Zone Liverpool.   On the outskirts of South Liverpool but easily accessible from a number of areas (close to the M62 Junction 6 and the M57 Junction 1).  The site consists of 3 separate private hire facilities with a large car park and waiting area.

Each field “Zone” has 6 foot fencing with privacy screens and space between each Zone.  All have a water supply and hose pipe and compostable poo bags, together with various seating areas for the humans. 
Some solar lighting has been added mostly to the perimeter fences, to provide some visibility (albeit limited) during dark nights and mornings.

The Adventure Zone is a 2 acre paddock with 6 foot deer style and rabbit fencing dug underground.
A truly beautiful meadow, with mature trees, and an area of woodland with a small stream running through.  Ideal for water loving dogs, the Adventure Zone has a rainwater splash/swim pond. The area has been fenced off although determined water loving dogs may find a way in.   
Ideal for your dogs to run, sniff, play and do want dogs enjoy.
For added fun we have introduced some ideas for play including tunnels and ramps.
Lots of photo opportunities including birthday signage.
Maximum 8 dogs / 3 cars (parking within the 2 acre field).
Suitable for reactive dogs.

The Action Zone is just under 2 acres with an area of mature woodland and lots of space for your dogs to run and play.   There is a low level agility style circuit consisting of hoopers, a tunnel, ramps, jumps, tyre mountain, cable reels and much more.  A sandpit and paddling pool are also available.
Maximum 8 dogs / 2 cars.

The Activity Zone is around a quarter of an acre and has been specifically designed for smaller dogs (up to 15 kg).
Mature trees, tree toys, tunnels, ramps, jumps, tyre moutains, sandpit and paddling pool.
Maximum 5 dogs / 2 cars.
Wheelchair / pram friendly - path of self binding gravel

description:
🐾 Paws4Play Dog Park – Secure Private Dog Walking Field in Cullompton, Devon

Over 286 5* Reviews on Googlemaps

Welcome to Paws4Play Dog Park, a purpose-built, secure dog walking field in Mutterton, near Cullompton, Devon (EX15 1RN) — where dogs can run free, play safely, and enjoy the great outdoors.

Set in the peaceful Devon countryside, Paws4Play offers exclusive, private use of a large, fully enclosed field with 1.9m secure fencing and stunning rural views. Whether your dog loves to zoom, sniff, or train, this is the perfect space to do it with confidence and complete peace of mind.

Our facilities go above and beyond a typical dog field. On-site you’ll find:
☕ A self-serve coffee machine for owners to relax and refuel
🚻 Clean, convenient toilet facilities
🚗 Ample on-site parking close to the field entrance
💧 Fresh water supply for dogs
🗑️ Waste bins and bags provided
🎾 Agility and enrichment equipment to keep dogs engaged
🌳 Seating and shaded areas for comfort in all seasons
💦 A filtered pond for splashing and cooling off
🏖️ A sandpit digging area for fun and enrichment

Each session is completely private, giving you sole use of the field for the duration of your booking. It’s perfect for reactive or nervous dogs, training sessions, or simply some quality time with your best friend.

Located just a few minutes from M5 Junction 28, Paws4Play is easy to reach from Cullompton, Tiverton, Wellington, and Exeter.

Come and see why dogs (and their humans) love visiting Paws4Play Dog Park — safe, scenic, and designed with dogs in mind.

field_name: Poundon Pastures – Secure Dog Walking Park – Oxfordshire Buckinghamshire
location: Hill View Farm, Main Street, Bicester, OX279BB, Buckinghamshire|Oxfordshire
description:
Premium Secure Dog Walking Park. Through the exclusive hire of our 2-acre secure dog walking park Poundon Pastures provides a safe, fun and secure environment to exercise and enjoy time with your dog. We have Secure 2m High Fencing, A Field Shelter, a drive in Secure Release Pen, Dog Wash Point and landscaped play features. Our site benefits from stunning and unique far reaching views over the Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire countryside 
 
 
We've put a great deal of thought into providing features designed for dog enrichment for both physical and mental stimulation. With play features designed with skill development in mind including developing gross motor skills, scent finding, and natural dog enrichment areas. The secure fencing allows for off leash fun, allowing a dog's instincts to show themselves. Dogs of all breeds and temperaments are welcome here, but the fencing around the secure dog field makes it perfect for dog training, recall training, bitches in heat, and some types of reactive dogs. 
 
The drive-in secure release pen is the ultimate in security, operating an 'air lock' system so you drive in, shut and latch the gate behind you before letting your dog out of your car, and then enter the secure dog field through the coded gate. We also have some netting up to minimise reactivity between dogs from different sessions. 
 
We have a fully online secure booking system, allowing you to make and manage your bookings online from your account. You will receive a confirmation email, and a booking code to access the park 1 hour before your bookings. 
 
On-site we have a field shelter to get away from the elements, a dog wash-down point to clear up muddy paws and fresh mains drinking water. We do hope that you enjoy visiting us at Poundon Pastures and look forward to welcoming you soon!

location: Castleford Gardens, Castleford Hill, Tutshill, Chepstow, Gloucestershire
description: Our secure fields are situated on the banks of the River Wye overlooking Chepstow surrounded by acres of organic pasture and ancient woodland. Located in Tutshill, walking distance from Chepstow town centre. We have two fields available for exclusive hire. A 3.5 acre exercise field containing some woodland (Big Field) and a Puppy Paddock of just over an acre. We have 6ft high fencing above ground dug into earth banking. We have aimed to make it escape proof for our dogs so we hope it will be for yours too! All booking slots are carefully planned so that you do not cross direct paths with another dog, there may however be one in the adjoining field. However, if you would rather have complete exclusivity then you have the option to book both fields, then that is also an option on the booking page. Our opening hours are from dawn till dusk so you can walk at a time to suit you. Our Big Field is ideal for both reactive dogs and dogs with poor recall. Or owners who just want to walk their dog off lead with the knowledge that they won’t meet another reactive dog. The Puppy Paddock is perfect for young dogs who need to work on getting used to being in open spaces in a safe and controlled way. Or for smaller or older dogs who want to run and sniff around but not necessarily walk too far. It is also an ideal space for any owner to focus on some training with their four legged companion. We do not have any agility equipment but there are some things for doggy interest and a water trough is available in both to wash and cool your pooches down.

field_name: Enclosed area for enrichment, confidence building and free work sessions

description: Enclosed secure area for enrichment or free work sessions. Booked by appointment only Parking available for one car One person at a time – can bring maximum of two dogs Shade and seating available, along with water for dogs These 30-minute sessions are much more than dogs searching for food! They provide opportunities for dogs to build confidence as they move around investigating different heights, different textures, different sounds, and scents.  They are simple, low impact activities that can be rewarding, helping dogs to slow down, improve posture and release tension in the dog’s body as they engage the sensory part of their nervous system. These sessions can also act as a stepping stone towards further learning and relaxation especially for those dogs who often feel anxious or fearful. These are also perfect for puppies and young dogs to safely learn about the world. Location: Holbeach Cost: £10 Email: contactdogbehaviourclinic@gmail.com to book

location: Freya's Meadow, Latton Street, Harlow, Essex, CM20 3SD, Essex
Little Cwrt Bach Farm, Pentre Lane, Cwmbran
description: South Wales’ first purpose-built secure Dog Adventure Parks. Here at the Cwtch we offer a safe, stimulating and enriching environment for you and your dog to enjoy quality time together. Our secure fields are situated in the heart of the welsh country side, surrounded by 29 acres of organic fields and woodland, we are conveniently located near the M4, just 1.6 miles from Cwmbran and 3.6 miles from Newport. Our secure dog parks are ideal for dogs that cannot be let off the lead in public places – perhaps they don’t enjoy meeting other dogs, or for those that lack recall. For dogs that feel anxious or nervous around other dogs, reactive dogs or simply just for dogs that need to work on training in an enclosed, safe environment. To put it simply, our Dog Adventure Park is perfect for anyone who enjoys watching their dog be happy, fulfilled and free. Our secure fields are available for private hire. You will have exclusive use of either our Dog Adventure or Dog Sensory Park. Our coded gate system, and carefully planned time slots means that you won’t be disturbed. ​ Are you feeling ready to give up on ever having a relaxed walk? Fed up of looking over your shoulder, scouring the horizon for dogs or other distractions? Do you have a dog who is reactive to other dogs, one that runs away from you on walks? Or a dog that just seems under-challenged, under-stimulated, a dog that would love to have more fun? This is exactly why we created our secure, safe and stimulating dog parks. ​ Our adventure park has over 10 different types of adventure play equipment & obstacles which means that your dog has plenty of challenges to stimulate and excite them. These include tunnels, ramps, log frames to climb, wooden houses and platforms, and climbing logs. Inside the park is a covered shelter and seating area where you can sit and relax whilst your dog runs, plays and explores. Our Adventure Play equipment introduces dogs to the world of jumping, climbing, balancing, crawling under and going around different obstacles. Our dog park helps with confidence and overcoming fears. It is a low-impact but challenging activity and can be varied according to age and fitness levels. ​

description: Welcome to Pawprints Pawprints is a family run business, which combines a number of dog related services to cover all your canine needs. Pawprints has been built with the welfare of dogs in mind, we have invested our time and care to create a safe environment for both dogs and clients. The Site The paddock is accessed via the main gate, which you drive through and close before letting your dogs out. There is parking for 2 vehicles. The paddock is set on a 2 acre site, with 6 foot deer fencing inside the perimeter fence for added security, to allow even the most active dogs the freedom to run. The space has been chosen for its natural radius, which in turn brings its own natural shaded areas. Seating areas placed under the trees for clients to provide shade and cover from the elements. Enrichment areas for your dogs to include, sandpit, tyres, paddling pool, agility set. Water bowls and poo bags are provided for clients to keep their dogs hydrated and keep the paddock clean ready for the next visitor. Ideal for reactive, sensitive, young dogs, a great way to start training, enhance your training, or just enjoy a safe walk. we have a small waterfall pond just outside the main paddock which is available to use in your time slot.

location: Green Lane, Ilsington , Northacombe, Newton Abbott, TQ13 9RB, Ilsington, Devon
description: Haytor Mutt Mayhem is situated on Green Lane, Ilsington approx 0.6 mile from the top of Green Lane or 0.5 mile from the bottom. Our address is Northacombe, TQ13 9RB. The postcode will get you onto Green Lane but not to our house as it does the whole of the road for the houses on the higher side! Once on Green Lane don’t turn off until you reach the farm then you will see our drive up to the field. There will be clear signs nearby to help and once you have arrived to point in correct direction. We are now on Google maps so use this code to get our exact location- H7HP+FG Ilsington, Newton Abbot What3Words-teams-signature-lavender Here at Haytor Mutt Mayhem we have made an area purpose built of approx 1.55 acres secured with 6ft 6″ high deer fence to enable you to exercise your dog and let it go crazy whilst you can sit and enjoy the fabulous views either down the valley or up to Haytor. There is an enclosed unloading area for up to 2 cars which you enter and close the gate behind you before letting you dog out into the safety of the main paddock, where there are plenty of things to help keep them occupied or just run! There is a plenty of space to throw a ball, go through the tyres and have a swim in our large 1500 litre water trough. There is a field shelter with a picnic table in/beside (table will be outside in summer months and inside during winter) should you need to shelter from the elements, plus other seats around the paddock to sit an admire the views. Inside the shelter are spare poo bags, treats and toys for the dogs to use.​ So if your dog is a rescue, struggling with recall, has a high prey drive (desire to chase other things) or in season then the paddock will give you a place to do this safely. Or if your looking for some where peaceful to sit and enjoy time with your dog our paddock will be perfect! We are only a stones throw from Haytor on Green Lane, which is only a short drive from the A38. There are some amazing facilities locally for eating and drinking, we have The Carpenters Arms in Ilsington just 2 mins across the valley, Ullacombe Farm shop only 5 mins over the hill on route back to Bovey Tracey. Both allow dogs on site so perfect for after your exercise to enjoy a bite to eat and We are open to talking to local dog walkers, puppy training groups and other groups about the hire of our paddock as we do have ample parking outside the  secure area. We do ask tho that there is no more than 3 dogs per person in the paddock at one time to ensure the poo is all cleared up.

location: Bristol, Dundry, North Somerset, BS41 8ND
description: A Shining Example of Canine Paradise:  Bristoldogfield.co.uk  Secure Dog Exercise Field A few years ago, I found myself daydreaming about owning a small piece of land—just a couple of acres where I could plant trees, grow some fruit bushes and vegetables, and most importantly, create a secure, beautiful space for my dogs to run free. I imagined that one day, I might even open it to the public so others could enjoy it too. Then, of course, the world changed—Covid struck, land prices soared, and the dream seemed to drift just out of reach. Still, I held onto hope. Then one day, while scrolling Facebook, I stumbled upon a post by Karl Wilson announcing his plans to create a dog exercise field in Dundry, Bristol. I was stunned and delighted—it was exactly what I had envisioned, but better yet, it was less than ten minutes from my home. I followed the journey from planning application to approval, cheering from the sidelines. But nothing could have prepared me for what Karl has actually achieved. This week, I finally visited pawsforpleasure.co.uk Dog Field with my dogs and have time to add some images—and to say I was blown away is an understatement. This is not just a dog field. This is a canine sanctuary, crafted with love, intention, and remarkable attention to detail. From the moment you arrive, it’s clear that nothing has been overlooked. The drive-in entrance and spacious turning circle are built to withstand the quirks of British weather. The field itself—an expansive 4.5 acres—is a thoughtful blend of manicured mown paths and wild, free-growing grasses. These paths meander naturally, inviting exploration rather than simply leading from A to B. Every feature has been carefully designed for comfort and joy—not just for the dogs, but for their humans too. There are canopied picnic benches for rest and reflection, and a shelter in the centre of the field for those unexpected showers. For the dogs? Think bridges, rocks, A-frames, high walks, tunnels, balance paths, and even a pond—a full adventure playground catering to everything from the energetic explorer to the curious sniffer. But the brilliance of this field doesn’t end with its amenities or its breathtaking views of Bristol, The Clifton Suspension Bridge, The 2nd severn Crossing and beyond into wales. What truly elevates Dundry Dog Field to something exceptional is Karl’s unwavering commitment to the environment. He hasn’t just created a field; he’s created an ecosystem. With wildflower meadows, layered hedgerows, specimen trees, and an owl box, this space is a thriving habitat-in-the-making for countless birds and wildlife. The sheer investment into the planting alone is nothing short of extraordinary—Karl is quite literally planting a forest for the future. I’ve had the pleasure of speaking with Karl many times throughout the planning process, and one thing is abundantly clear: this isn’t just a business. It’s a legacy project. His vision reaches far beyond dog walks and day-to-day use. He understands, deeply, the value of trees, of natural beauty, of spaces that nourish both animals and people. His work is a gift not only to the local community today, but to generations to come. “The true meaning of life is to plant trees under whose shade you do not expect to sit.” – Nelson Henderson As a homeopath for both people and pets, I understand the vital role that exercise, fresh air, and joy play in overall well-being. This activity ticks all the boxes—for both our animals and ourselves. www.homeopathypetcoaching.com & www.homeopathshaz.com In Bristol terms, this place is “gurt lush.” It’s everything you could dream of in a dog exercise field—and more. Karl Wilson has created something truly outstanding, and it deserves recognition, celebration, and wholehearted support. Because while the field is beautiful now, its true magic is in the future it’s quietly growing—with every pawprint on the path and every tree planted for tomorrow.

location: Calf Fallow Lane, Ts20 1pf
description: Introducing Pups Paddock, a secure dog walking field where pet owners and dog walkers can bring their dogs to enjoy off-leash exercise in a controlled environment. Our one-acre field is enclosed on all sides with a six foot fence creating a secure haven for dogs to socialise, exercise, and have fun. Getting here This is a Google maps link to the field entrance. Copy and paste in to your browser to use Google maps directions. https://maps.app.goo.gl/Qui8EPHXvrMFCD7p9 Alternatively, if you’re familiar with the area, follow these instructions : We’re on a private track down Calf Fallow Lane, our farm is called Follyfoot Banks. Our what3words are ///idea.cape.moon. From Station Road, Norton, cross the railway line and the entrance to Calf Fallow Lane is straight ahead of you. Please respect our neighbours as you go, there may be livestock, working animals, children and machinery on the track, always give way to them and be patient. Do not exceed 10mph. Follow the lane down to Brookfield Farm and turn right up a short bank. From here you will continue along a short private track for around two minutes. You will pass private dwellings, please respect our neighbours and drive carefully and slowly. We’re amongst working farms so there could be livestock, horses and children. Access to the field is on the left-hand side of the private track, look out for the big black metal gate (photo in gallery), the gate opens outwards. Parking is available inside the field by way of hardstanding, a maximum of two vehicles are allowed at any one time. FAQ Can I just turn up? No sorry, booking is by appointment only. How much is it? The price is £12 for up to 3 dogs, £1 per dog thereafter, up to a maximum of 6 dogs. How long do I get in the field? Each slot is for 45 minutes and starts on the hour, longer appointments are available, please get in touch to discuss – pupspaddock@gmail.com. Can I take my trainer with me? Yes, absolutely, however we do not condone any kind of negative training. Important info Please read the terms and conditions carefully. No smoking or vaping on site. Please take all litter, treats and toys home with you to avoid them causing a problem for others. Please pick up your dogs poo and place in the bin provided. There’s a bucket of soil in the field, please fill any holes your dog makes and report immediately for safety and security reasons. The field will be checked periodically but if you spot any problems please report immediately.

description: New for August 2023, Zoomies Zone Liverpool.   On the outskirts of South Liverpool but easily accessible from a number of areas (close to the M62 Junction 6 and the M57 Junction 1).  The site consists of 3 separate private hire facilities with a large car park and waiting area. Each field “Zone” has 6 foot fencing with privacy screens and space between each Zone.  All have a water supply and hose pipe and compostable poo bags, together with various seating areas for the humans. Some solar lighting has been added mostly to the perimeter fences, to provide some visibility (albeit limited) during dark nights and mornings. The Adventure Zone is a 2 acre paddock with 6 foot deer style and rabbit fencing dug underground. A truly beautiful meadow, with mature trees, and an area of woodland with a small stream running through.  Ideal for water loving dogs, the Adventure Zone has a rainwater splash/swim pond. The area has been fenced off although determined water loving dogs may find a way in. Ideal for your dogs to run, sniff, play and do want dogs enjoy. For added fun we have introduced some ideas for play including tunnels and ramps. Lots of photo opportunities including birthday signage. Maximum 8 dogs / 3 cars (parking within the 2 acre field). Suitable for reactive dogs. The Action Zone is just under 2 acres with an area of mature woodland and lots of space for your dogs to run and play.   There is a low level agility style circuit consisting of hoopers, a tunnel, ramps, jumps, tyre mountain, cable reels and much more.  A sandpit and paddling pool are also available. Maximum 8 dogs / 2 cars. The Activity Zone is around a quarter of an acre and has been specifically designed for smaller dogs (up to 15 kg). Mature trees, tree toys, tunnels, ramps, jumps, tyre moutains, sandpit and paddling pool. Maximum 5 dogs / 2 cars. Wheelchair / pram friendly – path of self binding gravel

description: 🐾 Paws4Play Dog Park – Secure Private Dog Walking Field in Cullompton, Devon Over 286 5* Reviews on Googlemaps Welcome to Paws4Play Dog Park, a purpose-built, secure dog walking field in Mutterton, near Cullompton, Devon (EX15 1RN) — where dogs can run free, play safely, and enjoy the great outdoors. Set in the peaceful Devon countryside, Paws4Play offers exclusive, private use of a large, fully enclosed field with 1.9m secure fencing and stunning rural views. Whether your dog loves to zoom, sniff, or train, this is the perfect space to do it with confidence and complete peace of mind. Our facilities go above and beyond a typical dog field. On-site you’ll find: ☕ A self-serve coffee machine for owners to relax and refuel 🚻 Clean, convenient toilet facilities 🚗 Ample on-site parking close to the field entrance 💧 Fresh water supply for dogs 🗑️ Waste bins and bags provided 🎾 Agility and enrichment equipment to keep dogs engaged 🌳 Seating and shaded areas for comfort in all seasons 💦 A filtered pond for splashing and cooling off 🏖️ A sandpit digging area for fun and enrichment Each session is completely private, giving you sole use of the field for the duration of your booking. It’s perfect for reactive or nervous dogs, training sessions, or simply some quality time with your best friend. Located just a few minutes from M5 Junction 28, Paws4Play is easy to reach from Cullompton, Tiverton, Wellington, and Exeter. Come and see why dogs (and their humans) love visiting Paws4Play Dog Park — safe, scenic, and designed with dogs in mind.

field_name: Poundon Pastures – Secure Dog Walking Park – Oxfordshire Buckinghamshire
location: Hill View Farm, Main Street, Bicester, OX279BB
description: Premium Secure Dog Walking Park. Through the exclusive hire of our 2-acre secure dog walking park Poundon Pastures provides a safe, fun and secure environment to exercise and enjoy time with your dog. We have Secure 2m High Fencing, A Field Shelter, a drive in Secure Release Pen, Dog Wash Point and landscaped play features. Our site benefits from stunning and unique far reaching views over the Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire countryside We’ve put a great deal of thought into providing features designed for dog enrichment for both physical and mental stimulation. With play features designed with skill development in mind including developing gross motor skills, scent finding, and natural dog enrichment areas. The secure fencing allows for off leash fun, allowing a dog’s instincts to show themselves. Dogs of all breeds and temperaments are welcome here, but the fencing around the secure dog field makes it perfect for dog training, recall training, bitches in heat, and some types of reactive dogs. The drive-in secure release pen is the ultimate in security, operating an ‘air lock’ system so you drive in, shut and latch the gate behind you before letting your dog out of your car, and then enter the secure dog field through the coded gate. We also have some netting up to minimise reactivity between dogs from different sessions. We have a fully online secure booking system, allowing you to make and manage your bookings online from your account. You will receive a confirmation email, and a booking code to access the park 1 hour before your bookings. On-site we have a field shelter to get away from the elements, a dog wash-down point to clear up muddy paws and fresh mains drinking water. We do hope that you enjoy visiting us at Poundon Pastures and look forward to welcoming you soon!

description: Private secure fenced 5 acre field Perfect for your nervous, reactive or sensitive dog near Broad Haven, Pembrokeshire Call or text to book 07789 887038 or find us on Facebook – The Hay Meadow Dog Walking Field

location: Castleford Gardens, Castleford Hill, Tutshill, Chepstow, NP167LF
description: Our secure fields are situated on the banks of the River Wye overlooking Chepstow surrounded by acres of organic pasture and ancient woodland. Located in Tutshill, walking distance from Chepstow town centre. We have two fields available for exclusive hire. A 3.5 acre exercise field containing some woodland (Big Field) and a Puppy Paddock of just over an acre. We have 6ft high fencing above ground dug into earth banking. We have aimed to make it escape proof for our dogs so we hope it will be for yours too! All booking slots are carefully planned so that you do not cross direct paths with another dog, there may however be one in the adjoining field. However, if you would rather have complete exclusivity then you have the option to book both fields, then that is also an option on the booking page. Our opening hours are from dawn till dusk so you can walk at a time to suit you. Our Big Field is ideal for both reactive dogs and dogs with poor recall. Or owners who just want to walk their dog off lead with the knowledge that they won’t meet another reactive dog. The Puppy Paddock is perfect for young dogs who need to work on getting used to being in open spaces in a safe and controlled way. Or for smaller or older dogs who want to run and sniff around but not necessarily walk too far. It is also an ideal space for any owner to focus on some training with their four legged companion. We do not have any agility equipment but there are some things for doggy interest and a water trough is available in both to wash and cool your pooches down.

field_name: THE BARK PARK – Fully Enclosed Private Dog Walking Fields For Hire
location: Unit 1, Ridding Lane, Whalley, Clitheroe, BB79HW
description: THE BARK PARK is an established 5-star doggy day care centre based on a secure four acre riverside location in the picturesque village of Whalley, Clitheroe, Ribble Valley. We have a total of two large open fields available for hire for your own private use. You can let your dog(s) make the most of our wide open spaces and purpose built agility equipment, whilst also enjoying plenty of play and exercise. We even have our own access to our neighbouring River Calder, which our dogs absolutely adore playing in! Most of all, you won’t have to worry about traffic, other dogs and other people, as each of our fields are fully secured and private. Hiring one of our fields couldn’t be easier! Simply head to our website www.thebarkpark.co.uk/book-online to check out our available slots and book a 55-minute private dog walking session for only £12. You can take as many as four dogs per each private dog walking slot. For those who would like to bring along five or more dogs, we have a variety of available options with larger slots. Please see our website for more information. www.thebarkpark.co.uk/book-online Payment can be made easily and securely online via PayPal or secure online payment via our website.

field_name: Enclosed area for enrichment, confidence building and free work sessions
location: Saracen's Head, Holbeach, Holbeach, PE12 8BB
description: Enclosed secure area for enrichment or free work sessions. Booked by appointment only Parking available for one car One person at a time – can bring maximum of two dogs Shade and seating available, along with water for dogs These 30-minute sessions are much more than dogs searching for food! They provide opportunities for dogs to build confidence as they move around investigating different heights, different textures, different sounds, and scents.  They are simple, low impact activities that can be rewarding, helping dogs to slow down, improve posture and release tension in the dog’s body as they engage the sensory part of their nervous system. These sessions can also act as a stepping stone towards further learning and relaxation especially for those dogs who often feel anxious or fearful. These are also perfect for puppies and young dogs to safely learn about the world. Location: Holbeach Cost: £10 Email: contactdogbehaviourclinic@gmail.com to book

field_name: Inca’s Field, Secure Private Dog Exercising Field, Fairlight
location: Peter James Lane, Fairlight, Guestling Green, Rother, East Sussex, TN35 4AH
description: Welcome to Inca’s Field! Whether you need to practice recall, puppy training, rehabilitation exercise or simply just exercise your dog(s) in peace, Inca’s Field is ideal. We are situated in Fairlight (near Pett), set in beautiful countryside. Our dog exercise field is 3 acres within our land, surrounded by a 2-metre-high deer fence and is secured with a slide bolted gate. You can enjoy an hour of exclusive use for £11. Or you can bring along a friend with their dog(s) to your session with no added cost! In each session, there is to be a total maximum of 6 dogs. All dogs must be registered on Web Collect. In the field, we have various dog agility equipment including ramps, see-saw, jumps, tyres, tunnel, and weave poles. We also have a shelter, fresh drinking water available for the dogs, dog waste only bin, several benches and a seasonal meadow with paths cutting through. If you are a dog walking business or run dog classes and would like to use the field, please contact us to discuss your requirements. Summer Sessions: 08:00am to 7:30pm Winter Sessions: 8:00am to 4:00pm Website: www.incasfield.weebly.com Booking Site: www.webcollect.org.uk/incas-field Email: incasfield@hotmail.com Instagram: @incasfield

location: Freya's Meadow, Latton Street, Harlow, Essex, CM20 3SD
Little Cwrt Bach Farm, Pentre Lane, Cwmbran, NP447AZ
description: South Wales’ first purpose-built secure Dog Adventure Parks. Here at the Cwtch we offer a safe, stimulating and enriching environment for you and your dog to enjoy quality time together. Our secure fields are situated in the heart of the welsh country side, surrounded by 29 acres of organic fields and woodland, we are conveniently located near the M4, just 1.6 miles from Cwmbran and 3.6 miles from Newport. Our secure dog parks are ideal for dogs that cannot be let off the lead in public places – perhaps they don’t enjoy meeting other dogs, or for those that lack recall. For dogs that feel anxious or nervous around other dogs, reactive dogs or simply just for dogs that need to work on training in an enclosed, safe environment. To put it simply, our Dog Adventure Park is perfect for anyone who enjoys watching their dog be happy, fulfilled and free. Our secure fields are available for private hire. You will have exclusive use of either our Dog Adventure or Dog Sensory Park. Our coded gate system, and carefully planned time slots means that you won’t be disturbed. ​ Are you feeling ready to give up on ever having a relaxed walk? Fed up of looking over your shoulder, scouring the horizon for dogs or other distractions? Do you have a dog who is reactive to other dogs, one that runs away from you on walks? Or a dog that just seems under-challenged, under-stimulated, a dog that would love to have more fun? This is exactly why we created our secure, safe and stimulating dog parks. ​ Our adventure park has over 10 different types of adventure play equipment & obstacles which means that your dog has plenty of challenges to stimulate and excite them. These include tunnels, ramps, log frames to climb, wooden houses and platforms, and climbing logs. Inside the park is a covered shelter and seating area where you can sit and relax whilst your dog runs, plays and explores. Our Adventure Play equipment introduces dogs to the world of jumping, climbing, balancing, crawling under and going around different obstacles. Our dog park helps with confidence and overcoming fears. It is a low-impact but challenging activity and can be varied according to age and fitness levels. ​

description: Welcome to Pawprints Pawprints is a family run business, which combines a number of dog related services to cover all your canine needs. Pawprints has been built with the welfare of dogs in mind, we have invested our time and care to create a safe environment for both dogs and clients. The Site The paddock is accessed via the main gate, which you drive through and close before letting your dogs out. There is parking for 2 vehicles. The paddock is set on a 2 acre site, with 6 foot deer fencing inside the perimeter fence for added security, to allow even the most active dogs the freedom to run. The space has been chosen for its natural radius, which in turn brings its own natural shaded areas. Seating areas placed under the trees for clients to provide shade and cover from the elements. Enrichment areas for your dogs to include, sandpit, tyres, paddling pool, agility set. Water bowls and poo bags are provided for clients to keep their dogs hydrated and keep the paddock clean ready for the next visitor. description: Haytor Mutt Mayhem is situated on Green Lane, Ilsington approx 0.6 mile from the top of Green Lane or 0.5 mile from the bottom. Our address is Northacombe, TQ13 9RB. The postcode will get you onto Green Lane but not to our house as it does the whole of the road for the houses on the higher side! Once on Green Lane don’t turn off until you reach the farm then you will see our drive up to the field. There will be clear signs nearby to help and once you have arrived to point in correct direction. We are now on Google maps so use this code to get our exact location- H7HP+FG Ilsington, Newton Abbot What3Words-teams-signature-lavender Here at Haytor Mutt Mayhem we have made an area purpose built of approx 1.55 acres secured with 6ft 6″ high deer fence to enable you to exercise your dog and let it go crazy whilst you can sit and enjoy the fabulous views either down the valley or up to Haytor. There is an enclosed unloading area for up to 2 cars which you enter and close the gate behind you before letting you dog out into the safety of the main paddock, where there are plenty of things to help keep them occupied or just run! There is a plenty of space to throw a ball, go through the tyres and have a swim in our large 1500 litre water trough. There is a field shelter with a picnic table in/beside (table will be outside in summer months and inside during winter) should you need to shelter from the elements, plus other seats around the paddock to sit an admire the views. Inside the shelter are spare poo bags, treats and toys for the dogs to use.​ So if your dog is a rescue, struggling with recall, has a high prey drive (desire to chase other things) or in season then the paddock will give you a place to do this safely. Or if your looking for some where peaceful to sit and enjoy time with your dog our paddock will be perfect! We are only a stones throw from Haytor on Green Lane, which is only a short drive from the A38. There are some amazing facilities locally for eating and drinking, we have The Carpenters Arms in Ilsington just 2 mins across the valley, Ullacombe Farm shop only 5 mins over the hill on route back to Bovey Tracey. Both allow dogs on site so perfect for after your exercise to enjoy a bite to eat and We are open to talking to local dog walkers, puppy training groups and other groups about the hire of our paddock as we do have ample parking outside the  secure area. We do ask tho that there is no more than 3 dogs per person in the paddock at one time to ensure the poo is all cleared up.

location: Larch Close, Rustington, Arun, West Sussex, BN16 3DD
description: The Secret Dog Garden is an enclosed canine enrichment facility which allows your dog to focus on their natural behaviours – sniff, search, investigate and explore, providing them with a complete mental and physical workout. (Please note the area is approximately 50metres by 50metres.) The area is designed from the dog’s point of view with sensory planting including lavender and rosemary, recycled objects with a scent history such as children’s toys, horse rugs and brushes, shoes and boots, hats and gloves, bicycle tyres and brooms. Scent cloths, feathers, and other items with various animal smells can also be discovered. Dogs see in a range of blue and yellow so items have been chosen to reflect this to give them a visual experience as well as an olfactory workout. Different textiles have been used to enhance the sense of touch with gravel, stone and wooden paving slabs around the outside areas, and indoor areas have non-slip mats of various material such as nylon, foam and natural fur, plus hanging items to brush against like scarves and beads. Our Great British birds provide a natural soundtrack in the garden, and indoor areas have bells, rattles and other items that make a sound when nudged with a nose. How your dog moves around the area is considered with different levels to reach via ramps or steps, plus objects to step over, step on, or avoid, dependent on your dog’s preference. As your dog moves around and explores, they will discover natural treats hidden in boxes, puzzles, snuffle mats and even ball pits. The Secret Dog Garden gives your dog the opportunity to simply be a dog, allowing them to make their own choices and explore at their own pace. For this reason, only one dog can visit at any one time, as it is their experience for them to enjoy undistracted. As all dogs are unique, each experience is planned on an individual basis taking into account your dog’s preferences, age and ability, character and behaviour, and the layout is adapted accordingly. It is also your opportunity for you to relax and simply observe your dog’s natural behaviour. On subsequent visits, the environment can be changed to reflect your dog’s preferences or provide additional opportunities.

description: We believe that our Dog Park is the Souths first ever adventure play ground for dogs and puppies. We want all our dog owners and their dogs to experience this adventure play ground in a safe and secure enclosure and we are developing it further adding new adventures and facilities for all to enjoy – take a look through our website and gallery pictures… We are pleased to announce that a regular Dog Training class will be starting at our Dog Park very soon too (more details to be provided soon) for those needing additional support with their dogs. Our Dog Park is the perfect answer for many. We accommodate those dogs who have temperament issues and those dogs who have hearing difficulties or are disobedient. Your dog may be recovering from an illness or has bad attitudes to other dogs or people. Maybe your dog is elderly or timid and just wants to be left alone to do there only thing in there own time. You may have a dog which is a valuable show dog or your dog may be on heat  and you don’t want other dogs getting involved or close to your dog. description: Welcome to Purbeck Dog Park Enclosed Dog Walking Fields, Pet Gundog & Scent Training Facility Purbeck Dog Park offers 6.5 acres of private exercise fields where your dogs can roam free and have fun. We have two fields available, Tranquil Meadow, a safe and quiet area for reactive and nervous dogs. For this field, we have a double gate entry and privacy netting as a visual barrier to the neighbouring field. This field also incorporates enrichment activites such as a digging pit, balance mushrooms, climbing platforms and a sensory  garden will be planted soon! The Adventure Zone is the largest area for all other users with a selection of enrichment activities for your dogs including a digging pit, see-saw, balance mushrooms, climbing platforms and much much more. These fields are an ideal solution if your dog has recall or training issues or she is in season.  If your puppy needs a safe introduction to open spaces without the distraction of public places then these private fields are just for you! You may need to practice those training techniques so come along and work your dog in a safe environment with minimal distractions.  Or just come and have fun with your dog and perhaps enjoy a cider at the farm bar just next door! We are open to registered dog walkers, dog events and dog shows and we will periodically invite guest trainers to include agility, hoopers and man-trailing. Our resident trainer, Muttley Solutions offers puppy, dog and pet gundog training and Dorset Dogs Scent World.  For all training and scent work, please refer to https://www.dogtrainingtherightway.co.uk We offer flexible times throughout the day and we allow a 10 minute changeover between visitors so please ensure you leave on time. If you wish to book multiple sessions or you are a registered dog walker, please call 07745 763271 to discuss. Our opening hours depend on the season but during the summer months, we will be open 7 days a week from 8am to 9pm (with the last booking being 8pm).  The rest of the year will be daylight hours dependent so times will change with the seasons.

location: Crabtree Canine Enrichment Centre, The Warren, Crowborough TN6 1UB, Crowborough, TN6 1UB
description: Crabtree Canine Enrichment Centre, Crowborough, East Sussex TN16 1UB Crabtree has been is a very special place which has been put together for dogs of all ages and breeds. It is situated just outside of Crowborough in East Sussex and backs onto the Ashdown Forest. It has been created with many things in mind in particular to encourage dogs to do what they really enjoy in a natural setting. It is individually set up for each dog that visits. Crabtree is an enrichment area, not an off lead field, and sessions are set up and monitored and which last from 45 minutes to an hour. Enrichment areas are places where dogs are invited to explore and finding food is part of the session, and  only good quality foods are used. Enrichment activities are really helpful for any dogs as they combine to provide sensory experiences and things to interact with which encourage proprioception and flexibility. Because Crabtree is part of a natural environment there are also many scents of the various animals that live in the area. Dogs need to be on a long lead and harness during a visit as this is shared experience between the dog and handler. This also helps dogs to build confidence in unknown areas and is especially helpful for recently rescued dogs, dogs that are undergoing rehab, dogs with behaviour issues as well as puppies. Crabtree comprises of 3 separate areas which comprise of an outdoor area, and 2 stables all provide slightly different experiences for dogs. Please note at there is no website at the moment, if you would like to know more or book a session please contact Pennie Clayton 07910 720961

description: Canine Capers operate a large field that’s perfect for dog walking. We offer a completely secure facility which can be booked in 30 minute intervals (or any multiple of) to exercise your dogs without worry of them escaping or meeting other dogs or people. We offer this space for £5 per 30 minute interval and you will be the only person using this space at the time meaning you can let your dog(s) roam free off the lead. You will be on private land which means you can exercise up to 8 dogs at the same time. You are not affected by the maximum 3 dog law that has been put into place for public pathways. The field is split into a 2 acre highly secure field with 6ft fences and a 4 acre field with 4.5ft fences. You are welcome to use both fields but the 4 acre field is not guaranteed to be completely secure. Please don’t use the 4 acre field unless your dog has basic recall. The field is located just off of the B4195 (Bewdley Road North). The field and the road it is on do not have an address but we are happy to provide directions via phone or email if needed. Alternatively, you can download the “What Three Words” app which will direct you to the right place if you enter our three words which are: typed.providing.spill. You can also view the area on Google Maps.

location: Welton Road, Braunston, Nr Daventry, NN11 7JG, Braunston, NN11 7JG
description: At Braunston Secure Dog walking Field we provide a safe stress-free environment for walking, training and exercising your dog without the worry of running off or meeting other dogs. Our field is surrounded by a 6ft fence designed to keep all dogs inside the exercising area safely. We have a large shelter so you can avoid the worst of the English weather while still being able to supervise your dogs from the dry. The field is very secure and in a private location. Staff are easily contactable during operating hours to answer any questions you may have and to make your session as fun as possible. We realise that sometimes it is necessary to be able to have a safe space to be able to allow our dogs off away from other dogs, whether it be because they are nervous or aggressive with other dogs or just for a place without distractions to do some training. When you book the field you have exclusive use for the session. We offer 50 minute time slots starting on the hour and finishing at 10 to the hour – this is to avoid meeting other users at the start and end of sessions. We are open during all daylight hours throughout the year. It is possible to book time slots well in advance and you can book regular slots each week. We allow up to 4 dogs per session but we don’t have a restriction on the number of people so you are welcome to meet up with friends to exercise your dogs together.

Having a family dog who can’t be off lead in open spaces, we understand how important it is to have somewhere your fur baby can run and just be a dog, without the worry of bumping into others. We have balls, launchers and rope toys available for use, alongside a small shelter to get out of the British weather! We also have sun shades, paddling pools and hammocks during the summertime. location: Lock House, Wootton Rivers Lock,, nr. Marlborough, Wiltshire, SN8 4NQ
description: Welcome to Towpath Tails Dog Park, a safe and calm environment for your dog to run, sniff, play and learn to their doggy hearts delight…and for you to relax and chill out in the rural canal-side setting while they have fun. Nestled within our own Christmas tree farm and alongside the beautiful Kennet and Avon canal in Wootton Rivers, Towpath Tails Dog Park offers all dog owners a peaceful corner of the Wiltshire countryside where they can let their dogs off lead safely to have the fun and freedom they deserve.Whether you want to train your puppy, let your older dog have a rummage, rootle and a run, improve your dog’s recall or you have a rescue dog where you need a safe space to help you build mutual trust and their confidence – Towpath Tails Dog Park is the perfect place. We offer two play areas – The Paddock and The Coppice. The Paddock is about half an acre with agility equipment and definitely LARGE ENOUGH FOR RUNNING AND PLAY, but also safe and small enough to keep watch and train. While The Coppice is a larger 3acre space with a mix of dense and loosely wooded areas. A BIG SPACE FOR RUNNING and SNIFFING, but also great for training and recall. Our dog exercise areas are both securely fenced with 6’ft high tensile fencing – for keeping the ‘jumpers’ safe; and low rabbit fencing for keeping the ‘diggers’ in. SECURE – Both of the play areas within Towpath Tails Dog Park are secure spaces available for private individual hire as well as for dog training and events. Both The Paddock and The Coppice have secure 6ft deer fencing all around the field pegged to the ground, with additional rabbit fencing around the bottom and both have various forms of additional screening. Both play areas have access to the secure gated car park from which there is then a further locked secure gate into the respective play area. Both The Paddock and The Coppice then each have a further access gate fenced to 6ft high with low level rabbit fencing for double security. FACILITIES – The play areas are situated well off the village road and are accessed through a gated secure private car park. The Paddock includes three jumps, a small tube, tyres and a pallet ramp for play. For the humans, there is a shelter with table and chairs and a clear view down the field. Water is provided, as is a poo bin. And sanitiser is available. The Coppice is a mix of densely packed and more openly spaced mature Christmas trees for a sniffers heaven. There is a shelter with a bench seat, water, a small paddling pool and a poo bin.  We visit both areas regularly to check the grounds, facilities and fencing, to top up the water, and to ensure that everything runs smoothly for when you arrive. OPENING HOURS – Our opening times vary by month but are generally in line with dawn & dusk hours. Some booking slots are restricted in late Nov & Dec when the Xmas tree farm is at its busiest. BOOKINGS – We welcome individuals, families, as well as professional dog walkers and dog trainers. Bookings can be made online with a live calendar booking system at www.towpathtails.com. Individuals, families, and dog walkers can book for 30mins or 1hour with dog training and events bookings available for longer. First time visitors should book an induction session and will be met and shown how everything works by David or Isaac. We look forward to seeing you when you visit.

field_name: Paws n The Paddock dog field for hire
location: The Paddocks, Saxon Green, Escomb, Bishop Auckland DL14 7SY, -1.708432, DL14 7SY
description: Would you like your dog to be able to run freely in a fully   enclosed area, with 6ft solid fencing all round, without the   worry of them running off or being difficult to catch? • Would you like to exercise your dog without meeting other   people, dogs or livestock? • Do you have a nervous, fearful or reactive dog who prefers   their own space? • Perhaps you have got a new dog, a deaf dog or a rescue   dog and need somewhere to exercise them safely? • Looking for a suitable location to take an older or less   mobile dog who prefers to wander around in their own   time and at their own pace? • Is your dog recovering from injury or an operation and   needs a quiet place to exercise? Paws n The Paddock Can Help! Here at our Paws n The Paddock dog field your dog can run freely, explore the surroundings and exercise to their heart’s content, until you are ready to take your tired but happy dog home. LocationThe Paddocks, Saxon Green, Escomb, Bishop Auckland DL14 7SY Tucked away in the village of Escomb, The Paddocks is our family home which comes with 1.5 acres of land. Being huge dog owners, we immediately fell in love with the place. The first thing we did when we moved in was to have 6ft solid fencing erected all around the property, to make it both safe for our dogs and private for us. On one corner of the land we set up a dog-friendly holiday let called Paddock Lodge. Happily that still left us with a large grassy area, which is now our dog field – somewhere we can relax when exercising our dogs. No more worrying about meeting aggressive/boisterous/over-sexed/out of control dogs or coming across other possible problems such as cars, footballers, joggers, cyclists, walkers or family groups etc. Field Hire Prices £10 per 50 minutes for 1-5 dogs£12 per 50 minutes for 6-8 dogs£14 per 50 minutes for 9-12 dogs£16 per 50 minutes for 13-16 dogsLarger groups on application Each field hire session lasts 50 minutes to allow for efficient handover, maintenance checks in between users and for us to let our own dogs out. location: Horse Ghylls Wood Farm, Rusper, Dorking, RH124PZ
description: Horse Ghylls Wood Farm in Rusper is a brand-new dog walking facility available to rent by the hour. Based on a 20 acre site in scenic West Sussex, we have 10 acres of securely fenced field space where your dogs can be off the lead and run to their hearts content – big or small there is plenty of space to wear out your energetic fury friends! Private time slots are available all day so that you have exclusive use of the field without the worry of bumping into other dogs who may or may not be friendly. The land is set in the beautiful West Sussex countryside just outside of Rusper village and has lovely views extending over Horse Ghylls Woods. You can even extend your walk and take shelter from the rain or hot sun by passing through a gate onto the Surrey/Sussex border paths and explore the dappled woodland and deep gullies beyond. Our fields are perfect for dogs that aren’t the social type or are nervous, anxious or in training – perhaps you would just like a peaceful walk with your pooches without worrying about other dogs charging up to you. We understand that public paths, parks, bridleways and streets simply aren’t always suitable for off-lead exercise or indeed enough to give your dog the exercise he or she needs to be healthy, fit and happy. On Site Facilities: Fresh drinking water on site Doggy & wellie wash down facilities (we know they just love to get muddy and smelly!) Water troughs in the field and fresh tap water in the parking area. Safe, free off-street parking Fun obstacles, jumps, tunnels etc coming soon Our Services: 1 Hour sole use @ £10 Weekly Walkers Basic Package: 4 slots for £30 (only £7.50 per session) Weekly Walkers Super Package: 8 slots for £50 (only £6.25 per session) Professional Dog Walkers packages (Basic or Super) Choose from 4 or 8 hours in a month at discounted rates. Up to 5 dogs included* Full Day/ Half Day – By quotation: Ask about doggy events, parties, training clinics & guest expert Why not try us out soon, get in touch to book your space. We look forward to seeing you!

location: Hollin Wood A20 Broomfield, Kent, ME17 1PZ
description: Introductory rate £5 per hour. Normal rate £10 per hour. Hollin Wood is a 3 acre wood based in Broomfield Maidstone Kent. The wood sits on a hillside flanked on either side by shallow valleys; the plateaux at the top has an unusual plantation of standard chestnuts. The lower slopes are home to young silver birch. Access is good being off the A20 with its own private gated entrance. There is a packed earth track running along either side of the wood for parking one vehicle at a time. On the West side there is sand/loam soil that has been extracted leaving a shallow quarry. Providing a perfect area in the woodland for dogs to investigate and prevent them from getting bored. There are lots of different areas that give dogs a lot to explore. There is a water station for the dogs at the front pedestrian access gate. We have provided two access points for safety, and request that you do not smoke whilst in the wood in case of fire. Hollin Wood is in what were the lands of the Leeds Castle Estate, and is considered ancient woodland that needs to be protected and is now in private ownership. The site is triangular in shape. Two sides are fenced with 6 ft chain link fence and the back edge is secured with stock fencing and strong chicken wire dug into the ground. The wood is part of a larger area called Castle wood, which links to the Len Valley Walk (LDWA) and as such has a lot to offer you in terms of extending your walk from being off lead in Hollin Wood to an on lead 5 mile walk into Lenham. Additionally, there is a dog friendly pub on the A20, a 10 minute walk from the wood called ‘The Gate Inn Pub’ which not only allows dogs in the garden but also serves food. We hope you make the most of your experience with us and enjoy not just the wood, but your local area too.

field_name: Parkour Park Dog Agility & Canine Parkour
location: Bromsgrove, B61 9NJ
description: So much more than just a secure compound . . . This field is packed with equipment for maximum physical and mental stimulation for your dog. Whether for competition or just for fun, it boasts one of the best purpose built canine Parkour courses in the county – one that has been designed with the help of an international dog parkour instructor, IMDT trainer and coach. With also a full set of (aluminium) dog agility contacts and professionally laid out Hoopers equipment, Parkour Park is the ideal place to teach your dog new skills, bond or build confidence. Equally if you have an elderly dog; one with short legs who tires easily; want to teach recall or you have mobility concerns yourself, this 0.75 acre field is also a good option as it’s perfect for a quiet potter or sniff about ! There’s also a Splash Pool, Dig Pit, Short Perimeter Walk, Scurry Run, Space for Playing Ball and a perfectly positioned swing chair to take in the view ! The perimeter fence is 6ft high and the field is surrounded by camouflage netting or vegetation. So it’s fully enclosed with no other animals in sight. Timeslots start at various times throughout the day and slots are 60 minutes long. They are booked online on an exclusive use basis with a 15 minute changeover between bookings so that dogs and visitors don’t have to bump into each other. Come and practise and / or enjoy a peaceful hour in a busy day !

field_name: Half Past Field at Bromsgrove Field Hire
location: B61 9NJ
description: So much more than just a secure compound . . . This field is packed full of enrichment activities for guaranteed interest and fun for you and your dog. It’s a popular favourite with owners of young or energetic dogs due to having a small hill, which dogs can run up and down to burn energy. At 3 acres, there is lots of space for zoomies, games or a medium length walk. The field also has: – A Splash Pool – Dig Pit – Scurry Run – Permanent Obstacles & Commercial Agility Equipment – Tunnels – Walking Paths – Both Long Grass & Short Grass To Suit Your Dog’s Preference – Much more . . . There has been significant investment in 6ft professional fencing, camouflage netting and ground reinforcement so it’s fully enclosed and more secure under foot all year round in high traffic areas. It is called the Half Past Field as timeslots start on the HALF HOUR rather than on the hour. This field has low level lighting for darker days and drains well. It is therefore open all year round between 06:30am and 20:20pm. Slots are booked on an exclusive use basis with a 10 minute changeover between bookings so that dogs and visitors don’t have to bump into each other. Come and try it out !

Stanton Waters Woodland Walks , Stanton Waters Farm, Swindon, Wiltshire, Swindon, sn6 7ry
description: 2 Acre Secure Dog walking Woodland Would you love to be able to walk your dog(s) off lead through the woods? With no fear of meeting other dogs, other people along the way or without having concerns about your dog running off? Well at Stanton Waters Woodland Walks that’s just what you can do. Come and try it for yourself. About Stanton Waters Woodland Walks Stanton Waters Woodland Walks is a secure private hire 2-acre woodland, set within the backdrop of 50 acres of secluded farm land. It boasts a fully enclosed hard standing car park, an enchanting trail that loops around the 2 acres of woodland with a green open space running through the heart of the woods that is perfect for ball throwing or dog training. We are located on the outskirts of Swindon near the beautiful village of Blunsdon. The entire 2 acres is securely fenced with 6ft of stock fencing and a secure entrance gate. It has good road links just an 18-minute drive from J15 of the M4 or a 15-minute drive from Cirencester. We offer long opening hours to find a time that suits you. We feel confident you will love the woods as much as we do. Stanton Waters Woodland Walks is accessed via a private off-road track after you turn off the B4019. The track is suitable for all cars (but modified or low-slung cars may need to check prior to visit). This leads you up to a private car park that is enclosed within the 2 acres of woodland. It is the perfect size to accommodate 2 cars comfortably and safe for unloading and loading your dog(s). For your convenience there is also access to an outside tap with fresh running water, unfortunately this may not be available in the colder extreme weather.   (Security cameras are in operation)

location: GL20 6HP
description:
Merlin’s Meadow is a whole 16 acres of offlead fun! 
It is two adjoining fields so you can make it two 8 acre areas if you wish. The boundary fence is all 6ft horsewire (very small mesh), with no barbwire and no gaps. 
Parking is onsite and within the 6ft fencing. 
For the dogs there are straw bales, jumps, agility tunnels, a sand pit, trees and shrubs. There are also water stations and three poop bins dotted about. 
There are picnic benches and a field shelter for humans!

location: Red House Farm, Marsh Road, Sutterton, PE20 2LR
description:
Verified with Full Planning Permission. 
2 secure paddocks are available to hire from half hour onwards. 
The park is donation based with no set fee, but a suggested £5 per half hour is a general guide. 
to book your slot go to  
https://smartscheduling.com/suttertondogpark 
You can book either paddocks  or if you have a dog with social issues book the whole park for exclusive private use  
Play dates for socialisation are held every Wed 1 to 2, Sat and sunday 9am – 10am you can meet other owners with  friendly dogs No need to book Just turn up. 
The park also runs regular training sessions, Kennel Club good Citizens scheme, Heelwork to music, socialisation,  obedience, ringcraft and puppy socialisation. 
After your dogs run, you can clean them up using our purpose built DIY dog wash where hot showers and powerful dryers will soon have your pet  clean again. 
We also do regular seminars, eye testing etc in the purpose built cabin on site. Check out the events page of our website for “Whats on or up coming events” 
We have 2 websites. 
The formal one 
https://www.facebook.com/suttertondogpark/ 
and the more popular and very active community group site 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/Suttertondogpark

description:
Located in the quiet mid Norfolk village of Foxley, our field is easily accessible to the surrounding Towns of Dereham, Fakenham, Aylsham and City of Norwich. Our facilities include a fully enclosed field, fenced to 6ft+ with a sheltered area for the days which are less than ideal. On site parking and customer toilet also available. Drinking water and bowls can be provided however we do encourage you to bring your dogs own bowls. 
We believe all dogs should be given regular off lead time to provide them with a chance to really stretch their legs and display their natural behaviours which cannot be achieved on lead. 
We welcome dogs of all ages and backgrounds. Whether you are looking for somewhere secure to exercise, train or simply play with your dogs in a private setting with no distraction from others, our field could be just what you are looking for.

location: 2, Courtenay Farm Cottages, Courtenay Road, Denstroude, Canterbury, CT2 9LG
description:
Just 2 miles from the end of the M2 and within 5 miles of Faversham, Whitstable & Canterbury, the dog enclosure is ideally situated for easy access. 
I have a 1/3 acre grassy paddock fully enclosed with 6′ high deer fencing available for safe off lead exercise.  There is a large off road parking area and once down in the paddock you can relax on the wooden bench seat and watch your dogs play with the toys. There’s a watering can to top up water bowls and a tap by the summerhouse. The views are stunning too.  
I like to meet first timers and show you the ropes, get you to sign a disclaimer and welcome you to the Denstroude Dog Club. Thereafter you can pop up whenever you like by texting or messaging to check availability.  I have rescued sighthounds, ducks, a donkey and a llama – and know how important it is for hounds to be relaxed and happy.  
£5 for 30 mins, £7 for 45 mins.

field_name: Country Boarding for Cats and Dogs enclosed Dog Park
location: Gannock Lane, Baldock, SG7 6NL
description:
Our dog park is situated in the rolling Chiltern Hills countryside of North Hertfordshire. Our 15 acre park is fully secure with a 1.8 mtr (6ft) perimeter fence, rabbit proofed at the bottom so dogs cannot escape underneath. You can join our daily group walks at 10.00 to 12.00 noon. Alternatively, users can hire it exclusively for 30 minute periods.  
The field is attractive for dog owners who require a safe supervised controlled area where dogs cannot escape or be attacked by aggressive dogs. 
Our facilities are also popular with groups who hire it for parties and meeting up. We also have an accessible 70 Sq mtr hall available for hire if an indoor area is required. 
Our attractive pet cafe with disabled toilet facilities are accessible to dog park users. Good free parking is available on site. 
We look forward to welcoming dog and your dog.

location: Dodside Road, Newton Mearns, Glasgow, Glasgow, G77 6PZ
description:
Scotland’s original, biggest and best dedicated secure off-lead exercise facility. 
Opened in early September 2016. Dodside Dog Runs offers secure, off the lead, exercise areas for dogs that need the freedom to run in a large area without the worry of getting lost. Your booking gives you exclusive use of the Run so if your dog is nervous of, or aggressive towards, other dogs you can all have a relaxed time, on your own or with friends. 
  
Flexible, friendly, fun  
 Prices start from as little as £5.50 per 30 minutes for up to 6 dogs (extra dogs £1 each, max 10) 
Book up to 2 months, or as little as 20 minutes, ahead 
Reschedule your own appointment without charge as little as 3 hours ahead 
Really bad weather? No problem, free rescheduling at the last minute or even during your booking if a storm comes in 
No quibble full refund for first time visitors if it doesn’t suit you for ANY reason (not had one yet!) 
Discount packages and special offers always available 
The Runs aren’t visible from each other (except as you pass) nor from the car park so reactive dogs can focus on fun rather than barking 
   
Easy to find, easy to book, easy to use  
 We’re on the B769 Stewarton Road 3 miles south of Whitecraigs Rugby Club (Newton Mearns) 
Book as few or as many slots as you like and pay all at the one time 
Pay by Paypal, debit or cards, or cash (by special arrangement) 
Turn up, park, walk out and in no time you’ll all be having a stress free time 
Club and group meetings by private arrangement 
 Both Libby’s Run and Harry’s Run (Libby is my cocker spaniel who has gracefully allowed the runs in her back garden, Harry was her predecessor) are approximately 3 acres of grassland surrounded by 6′ high ‘deer’ fencing which has a netting ‘skirt’ dug into the ground so your dog cannot easily get out even if they are a digger. There is a shelter for you to keep out the worst of the weather, bins for poo bags and fantastic views (with picnic tables), peace and quiet as well as ample parking! 
  
Set in the countryside about 4 miles south of Newton Mearns, Glasgow, the Runs are on agricultural land forming part of my Smallholding so be prepared not only for lovely views over Brother Loch but for a wee bit of hiking over sometimes wet or muddy ground to get there. Your dogs will love the walk out and back, you will love seeing them run free well away from the stresses of a public park.  
  
Richard, and Libby, look forward to bumping into you sometime 
  
Find us on Facebook -it’s where all the updates, reviews and news is found 
  
Join in the discussion on Facebook (opens in new window)
